name: ListEscalationPolicies
description:
Retrieve all existing escalation policies for alerts.

This tool retrieves a list of all escalation policies, which define alert notifications for users over time. It requires scope authorization for access.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version to accept as a versioning header. Used for API response version control.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Indicate the media type for the response, typically 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of escalation policy results returned per page. Used for pagination.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The starting point for pagination in the search results. Specify an integer to skip past a number of elements.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: filter_by_name
parameters.description: Filters results to include only records with names matching the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: filter_by_user_ids
parameters.description: Array of user IDs to filter escalation policies where these users are targets.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only escalation policies on which any of the users is a target.

parameters.name: filter_by_team_ids
parameters.description: An array of team IDs to filter results. Only returns policies for specified teams. Requires `teams` ability.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.name: additional_models_to_include
parameters.description: Array specifying additional models ('services', 'teams', 'targets') to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

parameters.name: sort_results_by
parameters.description: Specify the field to sort the results on, such as 'name', 'name:asc', or 'name:desc'.

value_schema.description: Used to specify the field you wish to sort the results on.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total field in pagination responses, showing the total number of entries.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.description: Filters the results, showing only escalation policies on which any of the users is a target.

value_schema.description: Filters the results, showing only escalation policies on which any of the users is a target.

parameters.name: team_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

value_schema.description: An array of team IDs. Only results related to these teams will be returned. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.

parameters.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional Models to include in response.

value_schema.description: Used to specify the field you wish to sort the results on.
